The Gold Standard of Practice

In the disability sector, "Under Supervision" isn't a sign of a lack of skill—it is a sign of a commitment to clinical excellence. It means every strategy, assessment, and Behaviour Support Plan (BSP) is vetted by a Senior Practitioner to ensure it meets the NDIS Quality and Safeguards Commission's standards.

How This Benefits You

1. Dual Expertise

When you work with me, you aren't just getting my insights. You are getting the combined experience of myself and my Clinical Supervisor. This "four-eyes" principle ensures that complex cases are viewed from multiple professional angles, reducing bias and improving outcomes.

2. Compliance & Safety

The NDIS Capability Framework is rigorous. Working under supervision ensures that all documentation regarding Restrictive Practices is legally compliant, reducing the administrative burden on families and providers while keeping participants safe.

3. Modern, Evidence-Based Methods

Practitioners under supervision are often the most up-to-date with the latest academic research and Positive Behaviour Support (PBS) methodologies. We combine this fresh research with the "tried and tested" wisdom of veteran supervisors.

FAQs About Supervision

  • Does it cost more? No. The NDIS hourly rate for behaviour support remains the same regardless of the practitioner's level. You are essentially getting two professionals for the price of one.
  • Will I ever meet the supervisor? Usually, the supervisor works behind the scenes, but they are always available to review data and provide guidance on complex situations.
  • Is it private? Absolutely. Supervision is a confidential professional process designed solely to improve the quality of care.

Moving Forward

Transparency is the foundation of my practice. If you have questions about my supervision arrangements or would like to know more about the Senior Practitioners I consult with, I am always happy to discuss this during our initial meeting.
